problems.title: Satisfiability of Equality Equations (Union Find)
problems.description:
You are given an array of strings equations that represent relationships between variables where each string equations[i] is of length 4 and takes one of two different forms: "xi==yi" or "xi!=yi". Here, xi and yi are lowercase letters (not necessarily different) that represent one-letter variable names.

Return true if it is possible to assign integers to variable names so as to satisfy all the given equations, or false otherwise.

Input Format:
First line contains an integer n (number of equations).
Next n lines contain strings representing each equation.

Output Format:
Print 'true' if all equations can be satisfied, otherwise print 'false'.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
2
a==b
b!=a

Sample Output 1
false

Explanation:
If we assign a = 1 and b = 1, the first equation is satisfied but not the second.

Sample Input 2
2
b==a
a==b

Sample Output 2
true

Explanation:
We could assign a = 1 and b = 1 to satisfy both equations.
problems.constraints:
1 <= equations.length <= 500
equations[i].length == 4
equations[i][0] is a lowercase letter
equations[i][1] is either '=' or '!'
equations[i][2] is '='
equations[i][3] is a lowercase letter
